Class GameViewModel

java.lang.Object

      private boolean isHighestFrisbeePointReached
      Helper property for the frisbee movement calculation. Indicates if the highest point, the frisbee is allowed to be, is reached.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameViewModel

      public GameViewModel(Game gameModel, Level levelModel, Team teamModel, Character characterModel)
      Constructs the game model view and sets all needed model instances. Initializes all values needed for bindings and all flags needed for the game. Also subscribes to the character model events to be able to react on changes triggered by the socket connection. Starts the countdown and animation timer.
      Parameters:
      gameModel - game model instance
      levelModel - level model instance
      teamModel - team model instance
      characterModel - character model instance

  • Method Details

    • initializeCharacters

      private void initializeCharacters()
      Sets initial positions and catching zones for own and other character, left or right depends on the own character type. Also sets all related flags.

    • initializeFrisbee

      private void initializeFrisbee()
      Sets initial frisbee position and all related flags.

    • initializeLives

      private void initializeLives()
      Sets the properties for the initial lives.

    • startAnimation

      private void startAnimation()
      This method is the heart of the game. Starts the animation timer, detects (own) character movement and executes the frisbee's throw.

    • startCountdown

      private void startCountdown()
      Starts the countdown in the top panel, counts down 1 each second. On game over the timeline stops. When the countdown reaches 0, either the level success or the game success dialog visibility flag is set to true.

    • pauseCountdown

      private void pauseCountdown()
      Updates the team model with current data. Pauses the timer in the top panel and sets the showQuitConfirmDialog visibility to true.

    • executeOtherCharacterMovement

      private void executeOtherCharacterMovement(PropertyChangeEvent event)
      This method is called when the other character moves. Moves the other character depending on the values received from the socket connection.
      Parameters:
      event - property change event

    • executeOtherCharacterFrisbeeThrow

      private void executeOtherCharacterFrisbeeThrow(PropertyChangeEvent event)
      This method is called when the other character throws. Sets the frisbee's throw parameter as received from the socket connection and triggers a frisbee's throw from the other character.
      Parameters:
      event - property change event

    • updateOtherCharacterGameRunningStatus

      private void updateOtherCharacterGameRunningStatus(PropertyChangeEvent event)
      This method is called when the other character changes the game running status, e.g. by continuing the level or stopping the game. It either opens or closes dialogs or notifies the view to continue the game, so the game of both players is synchronized.
      Parameters:
      event - property change event

    • updateOtherCharacterOnDisconnect

      private void updateOtherCharacterOnDisconnect(PropertyChangeEvent event)
      This method is called when the other player disconnects from the game. It opens a disconnect dialog.
      Parameters:
      event - property change event

    • frisbeeMove

      private void frisbeeMove()
      The frisbee movement calculation. Should be called and executed in the animation timer.

    • incrementScore

      private void incrementScore()
      Increments the score on the score label. Does not save anything, this will be done only when the level is finished.

    • removeLife

      private void removeLife()
      Removes a life from the remaining lives and updates the observable array list, so the changes are reflected in the view. If the last life is lost, the game over dialog is shown.

    • resetThrowParameter

      private void resetThrowParameter()
      Helper function to reset the throw parameter for a frisbee's throw.

    • setFrisbeeTimeout

      private void setFrisbeeTimeout()
      Sets a timeout. Can be used after a frisbee's throw was done.

    • hasOwnCharacterTheFrisbee

      private boolean hasOwnCharacterTheFrisbee()
      Helper function to check if own character is holding the frisbee.
      Returns:
      true if character holds the frisbee, false if not

    • setFrisbeePositionToOwnCharacter

      private void setFrisbeePositionToOwnCharacter()
      Updates the frisbee's position to the right hand of the own character.

    • setFrisbeePositionToOtherCharacter

      private void setFrisbeePositionToOtherCharacter()
      Updates the frisbee's position to the right hand of the other character.

    • isLeftBorderReachedByCharacter

      private boolean isLeftBorderReachedByCharacter()
      Helper function to check, if the own character has reached the left scene border.
      Returns:
      true if left border is reached, false if not

    • isRightBorderReachedByCharacter

      private boolean isRightBorderReachedByCharacter()
      Helper function to check, if the own character has reached the right scene border.
      Returns:
      true if right border is reached, false if not

    • isCharacterAllowedToJump

      private boolean isCharacterAllowedToJump()
      Helper function to check, if own character is allowed to jump.
      Returns:
      true if character is allowed to jump, false if not

    • throwFrisbee

      public void throwFrisbee()
      This method is called when the own character throws the frisbee. It sets the frisbee's throw parameter and triggers the throw in the animation timer.

    • moveCharacterLeft

      public void moveCharacterLeft()
      This method is called when the player presses the arrow key left. It sets the flag for the own left movement if the character is allowed to move left.

    • moveCharacterRight

      public void moveCharacterRight()
      This method is called when the player presses the arrow key right. It sets the flag for the own right movement if the character is allowed to move right.

    • stopCharacterMoveLeft

      public void stopCharacterMoveLeft()
      This method is called when the player releases the arrow left key. It sets the flag for the own left movement to false and triggers a stop.

    • stopCharacterMoveRight

      public void stopCharacterMoveRight()
      This method is called when the player releases the arrow right key. It sets the flag for the own right movement to false and triggers a stop.

    • jumpCharacter

      public void jumpCharacter()
      This method is called when the player presses the arrow up key. It triggers a jump if the character is allowed to jump.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Triggers a disconnect so the other client can react.

    • showQuitConfirmDialog

      public void showQuitConfirmDialog()
      Triggers the "Pause" Dialog and sends GAME_RUNNING=false to the other client.

    • continueGame

      public void continueGame()
      Continues the game after level success and sends a message to the other client.

    • resumeGame

      public void resumeGame()
      Continues the game after pause and sends a message to the other client.

    • saveGame

      private boolean saveGame()
      Save the game data from the team model to the backend.
      Returns:
      true if saving was successful

    • saveAfterLevelSucceeded

      public boolean saveAfterLevelSucceeded()
      This method is called when a level has been finished successfully. It increases the level and triggers a save to the backend.
      Returns:
      true if saving was successful

    • saveAfterGameSucceeded

      public void saveAfterGameSucceeded()
      This method is called when a game has been finished successfully. It triggers a save to the backend and sets the team inactive.

    • saveAfterGameOver

      public void saveAfterGameOver()
      This method is called when a game is over due to lost lives. It triggers a save to the backend and sets the team inactive.

    • getTeamLivesHiddenProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty getTeamLivesHiddenProperty(int lifeIndex)
      Method for the binding of the visibility of a life with the given index with an element in the view.
      Parameters:
      lifeIndex - the index of the life
      Returns:
      flag for the visibility of the team life with the given index

    • getCharacterLeftXPositionProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty getCharacterLeftXPositionProperty()
      Method for the binding of the left character's x position value with an element in the view. Can be either own character's position or other character's position.
      Returns:
      left character's x position value

    • getCharacterLeftYPositionProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty getCharacterLeftYPositionProperty()
      Method for the binding of the left character's y position value with an element in the view. Can be either own character's position or other character's position.
      Returns:
      left character's y position value

    • getCharacterRightXPositionProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty getCharacterRightXPositionProperty()
      Method for the binding of the right character's x position value with an element in the view. Can be either own character's position or other character's position.
      Returns:
      right character's x position value

    • getCharacterRightYPositionProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty getCharacterRightYPositionProperty()
      Method for the binding of the right character's y position value with an element in the view. Can be either own character's position or other character's position.
      Returns:
      right character's y position value

    • getFrisbeeXPositionProperty

      Returns:

      Method for the binding of the frisbee's y position value with an element in the view.
      Returns:
      frisbee's y position value

      the game over dialog visibility flag

      Method for the binding of the visibility of the disconnect dialog with an element in the view.

    • getButtonLevelContinueTextProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.StringProperty getButtonLevelContinueTextProperty()
      Method for the binding of the level continue button's text value with an element in the view.
      Returns:
      level continue button text value

    • getLabelLevelSuccessProperty
